name: Chipotle Chicken Chili or "C3"
description: This chipotle chicken chili has smoky chipotle peppers, shredded chicken, and hearty beans for a meal that will fill you up and satisfy your taste buds.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 4oz. can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce (up to) ($0.68)

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Cook both in a large pot with olive oil over medium heat until soft and transparent (about 5 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Cook both in a large pot with olive oil over medium heat until soft and transparent (about 5 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken breast, V8 juice, diced tomatoes, beans (drained), corn, chili powder, cumin, and oregano. Stir to combine. Open the can of chipotle peppers and take two out. Mince them and add to the pot. Take two spoonfuls of the adobo sauce from the can and add to the pot as well. Stir it on up.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chicken breast, V8 juice, diced tomatoes, beans (drained), corn, chili powder, cumin, and oregano. Stir to combine. Open the can of chipotle peppers and take two out. Mince them and add to the pot. Take two spoonfuls of the adobo sauce from the can and add to the pot as well. Stir it on up.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the pot up to a boil over medium-high heat with a lid. Once reaches a boil, reduce the heat to low and let the pot simmer for one hour (lid on).
recipeInstructions.name: Bring the pot up to a boil over medium-high heat with a lid. Once reaches a boil, reduce the heat to low and let the pot simmer for one hour (lid on).

recipeInstructions.text: After an hour, carefully remove the chicken breast and shred the meat using two forks. Return the shredded meat to the pot. Give the chili a taste and add more chipotle peppers if desired. Add salt as needed. I added about one teaspoon of salt, but this will depend on how salty your beans were, so start with a little and add more as needed.
recipeInstructions.name: After an hour, carefully remove the chicken breast and shred the meat using two forks. Return the shredded meat to the pot. Give the chili a taste and add more chipotle peppers if desired. Add salt as needed. I added about one teaspoon of salt, but this will depend on how salty your beans were, so start with a little and add more as needed.

review.reviewBody: This is now on my short list of go to recipes. I had a few squash that needed to be prepared and since I love vegetables, I diced them and added them in with the onions. I added a little more chili powder and chipotle than the recipe called for just for flavor and heat.

I was looking for a recipe to use up specific leftovers and was directed to this one. It was delicious! Everyone had seconds, and what was left was quickly claimed for tomorrow‚Äôs lunch. We will be adding this to our favorite recipes.
I have made this chili probably a dozen times, just as the recipe instructs, and it‚Äôs ALWAYS delicious. Although curious what the calorie count is... has anyone calculated?
One of my Budget Bytes favorites. ¬†Made it again tonight. ¬†So easy and delicious. ¬†And great leftover! ¬†Thanks Beth!

Omg! Hands down the best chili recipe out there. I was so skeptical since I didn‚Äôt have the v8 juice. I just subbed some veg stock and it was mind blowing and so filling as well. Thank you for sharing your recipe üôåüòÅ
